vulnerabilities.name: External Storage Accessing
vulnerabilities.description: Found external storage access API. Please remember not to write security-critical files to external storage.
vulnerabilities.remediation: Please revise all the external storage access in order to identify eventual leaks of critical information.

references.text: Further information on writing files can be found in the official documentation [[1]].

vulnerabilities.name: Not sufficient code obfuscation
vulnerabilities.description: The app seems not using sufficient code obfuscation.

vulnerabilities.name: WebView intercept request
vulnerabilities.description: Android allows apps to load resources (e.g, JavaScript, CSS files etc.) in a web page in a WebView, and control the resources being loaded in a webpage via the `shouldInterceptRequest` method in `WebViewClient`. The `shouldInterceptRequest` method takes an instance of WebView and the resource request as input and returns a response object. If the response object returned is `null` then the WebView is loaded with the web page containing the resource that was requested. But if a non-`null` response is returned then the WebView is loaded with the web page containing the non-`null` response. If the app does not validate the resource in `shouldInterceptRequest` method of `WebViewClient`, any resource can be loaded into WebView.

references.text: Further information can be found on the Android Developer Guide [[1]].

code.what: shouldInterceptRequest not overridden, any resource can be loaded
